bio.summary: Big John Bates & the Voodoo Dollz unique trash-blues sound mashes Punk, Blues & Rock’n’Roll with a live show sonically powered by Gretsch-endorsed guitarist/vocalist Big John Bates, Brandy Battery’s upright, JT Brander on drums & featuring Little Miss Risk’s Gaslight Revolutionaries Burlesque. Their fourth album “Bangtown” was released in Europe in May 2009 accompanied by a live video feature on MySpace with great reviews from over 20 top EU magazines.
bio.content:
Big John Bates & the Voodoo Dollz unique trash-blues sound mashes Punk, Blues & Rock’n’Roll with a live show sonically powered by Gretsch-endorsed guitarist/vocalist Big John Bates, Brandy Battery’s upright, JT Brander on drums & featuring Little Miss Risk’s Gaslight Revolutionaries Burlesque. Their fourth album “Bangtown” was released in Europe in May 2009 accompanied by a live video feature on MySpace with great reviews from over 20 top EU magazines. Produced by Todd Simko (Pure, Xavier Rudd) and showcasing 13 stories of the midnight city the theme is reflected in I, Braineater’s cover art while the band is joined by some great Vancouver musicians including Jimmy Roy (Ray Condo) & Jen Chycoski (Choir Practice). “One of Vancouver’s most notorious musicians” - The Globe & Mail “Fun as a midnight drag race fueled by a fifth of bourbon” - Exclaim Magazine “The devil is a Big John Bates groupie, that's for sure” - SLUG Magazine “A high-octane musical experience” - Orange County Music Examiner “Big John Bates digs in his claws and does his own thing and dares you to try to walk away. I'm not sure why anyone would want to” - Yorkton This Week “Bates is the next great hope for garage rock, combining the energy of Reverend Horton Heat with the hooks of the White Stripes.” - Monday Magazine “Alongside the likes of the Reverend Horton Heat as a voodoo rock guitar player to watch” - Total Guitar Magazine
